segments.text: I see the boy on that stool, and I’m terrified he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and the woman doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl is just watching, and it’s like she doesn’t care about the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and someone is going to slip and get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so upset when she finally sees the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, but inside, it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will get caught before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window is so bright, but it’s like no one is paying attention to the real problems.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to look away because I’m so worried about what’s going to happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR
